text:
I visited the Forest Walk at Mount Faber yesterday, but unfortunately, it was closed for maintenance due to a slope failure that occurred in February 2023. The closure is expected to last until July 2026 as repairs are being made to ensure safety and stability. While I was disappointed not to experience the elevated walkway and its promised views, I appreciate the importance of maintaining these natural spaces.

Despite the closure, the surrounding area offers beautiful alternative paths along Telok Blangah Heights, which still provide opportunities for exploration and enjoying nature. The lush greenery and fresh air are refreshing, making it a worthwhile visit even without access to the Forest Walk.

I look forward to returning once the repairs are complete to fully enjoy this scenic trail. For now, check for updates before your visit, and consider exploring other parts of the Southern Ridges in the meantime!

A nice walk through the woods and on the long bridge-kind of trails that cut the middle of the park. Currently under maintainence and we have to go down the Earthly trail abit to go to the Henderson bridge
Part of the elevated forest walk (0.8km) from Alexandra has opened. It closes at the point where there are stairs bringing you back to the ground level earth trail (opposite depot road)
This will bring you all the way to the Henderson Wave bridge but the Forest Walk is closed now for maintenance.
Unfortunately closed due to the heavy rain. I hope it reopens soon, looks amazing even from the earth trail below!
